longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. 

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Holders of passports issued by Turks
and Caicos Isl. can obtain a visa on arrival for a max. stay
of 30 days. Fees vary and must be paid in USD. Extension of
stay possible for additional 150 days. (SEE NOTE 51704) (SEE
NOTE 56148) 
    NOTE 51704: Passengers traveling as tourists must obtain
   an ETA on arrival, or before arrival at www.eta.gov.lk . 
    NOTE 56148: Passengers traveling for business must obtain
   an ETA before travel from a Sri Lankan representation
   abroad.
Additional Information:
- Visitors must hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their
  stay and documents required for their next destination. 
Warning:
- Nationals of Turks and Caicos Isl. not holding return/onward
  tickets could be refused entry
vaccination:
Passengers arriving within 6 days after leaving or transiting
countries with risk of yellow fever transmission For details, click here
, Sao Tome and Principe, Somalia or Tanzania and not holding a
yellow fever vaccination certificate are subject to quarantine
for 10 days.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P. vivax is
  low and exists throughout the year, except in the districts
  of Colombo, Galle, Gampaha, Kalutara, Matara and Nuwara
  Eliya. Recommended prevention in risk areas: A.
